problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCD shape is a combination of a rectangle and a semi-circle, the perimeter of the ABCD shape is 82 and the diagonal of the BFGC rectangle is 16, compute the length of the AB side of the ABCD shape. Assume $\pi=3.14$. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 22540.57)
C = (14421.72, 22540.57)
D = (14421.72, 34.23)
F = (34.23, 29540.57)
G = (14421.72, 29540.57)

# Create figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 16))

# Draw the blue rectangle (A, B, C, D)
blue_rectangle = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D], closed=True, color="blue", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(blue_rectangle)

# Draw the blue semicircle
arc_radius = 7227.977284969079
semicircle = patches.Wedge(
    center=((A[0] + D[0]) / 2, (A[1] + D[1]) / 2),
    r=arc_radius,
    theta1=0,
    theta2=180,
    color="blue",
    alpha=0.6
)
ax.add_patch(semicircle)

# Draw the pink rectangle (B, F, G, C)
pink_rectangle = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, C], closed=True, color="pink", alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(pink_rectangle)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=1.0, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draw a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, C, D)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, G, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# -- LENGTH ANNOTATION -- #
ax.text((B[0] + F[0]) / 2, (B[1] + F[1]) / 2, "7", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="center")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 20034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-9965.77, 40034.23)
ax.set_aspect("equal")
ax.axis("off")

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The diagonal of the BFGC rectangle is 16 and the length of its BF side is 7, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{16^2 - 7^2} = \sqrt{256 - 49} = \sqrt{207} = 14.39$. The perimeter of the ABCD shape is 82 and the length of the BC side is 14.39, so $2 * OtherSide + 14.39 + \frac{14.39 * 3.14}{2} = 82$. So $2 * OtherSide = 82 - 14.39 - \frac{14.39 * 3.14}{2} = 82 - 14.39 - \frac{45.18}{2} = 82 - 14.39 - 22.59 = 45.02$. Therefore, the length of the AB side is $\frac{45.02}{2} = 22.51$. Therefore the final answer is 22.51.
